executive_summary.compliance_status: NON-COMPLIANT - Critical issues must be resolved

critical.recommendation: Restrict ingress to specific IP ranges. Use least privilege principle for network access.
Restrict ingress to specific IP ranges. Use least privilege principle for network access.
Restrict ingress to specific IP ranges. Use least privilege principle for network access.
Set publicly_accessible = false. Use private subnets and VPN/bastion for access.
Use secrets management services (AWS Secrets Manager, GCP Secret Manager). Reference secrets via variables.

critical.description: Firewall rule allows traffic from anywhere (0.0.0.0/0)
critical.recommendation: Restrict source_ranges to specific IP ranges. Use Identity-Aware Proxy where possible.

critical.description: Cloud SQL instance has public IP enabled
critical.recommendation: Set ipv4_enabled = false. Use Private IP and Cloud SQL Proxy for secure access.

high.description: S3 bucket does not have encryption enabled
high.recommendation: Enable server-side encryption using aws_s3_bucket_server_side_encryption_configuration with AES256 or aws:kms.

high.description: RDS instance does not have encryption enabled
high.recommendation: Enable storage_encrypted = true and specify kms_key_id for encryption at rest.

high.description: GCS bucket does not have customer-managed encryption
high.recommendation: Configure encryption block with default_kms_key_name for CMEK encryption.

medium.description: Instance does not have CloudWatch logging configured
medium.recommendation: Configure CloudWatch Logs for monitoring and auditing. Enable detailed monitoring.

medium.description: GCE instance does not have logging configured
medium.recommendation: Enable Cloud Logging and Cloud Monitoring. Configure log sinks for security events.

medium.description: GCE instance does not have logging configured
medium.recommendation: Enable Cloud Logging and Cloud Monitoring. Configure log sinks for security events.

recommendations.action: Restrict ingress to specific IP ranges. Use least privilege principle for network access.
Restrict source_ranges to specific IP ranges. Use Identity-Aware Proxy where possible.
Use secrets management services (AWS Secrets Manager, GCP Secret Manager). Reference secrets via variables.
Set ipv4_enabled = false. Use Private IP and Cloud SQL Proxy for secure access.
Set publicly_accessible = false. Use private subnets and VPN/bastion for access.
Configure encryption block with default_kms_key_name for CMEK encryption.
Remove access_config block. Use Cloud NAT or Identity-Aware Proxy for access.
Configure encryption_key_name for CMEK. Enable automated backups with encryption.
Enable storage_encrypted = true and specify kms_key_id for encryption at rest.
Enable server-side encryption using aws_s3_bucket_server_side_encryption_configuration with AES256 or aws:kms.
